title: Introduction to TypeScript
content: TypeScript is a strongly typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript. It offers static typing, classes, interfaces, and other features to enhance JS development.
questions: What is TypeScript and how is it different from JavaScript?
What are the benefits of using TypeScript in large projects?

title: Type Annotations
content: Type annotations allow developers to define the type of variables, function parameters, and return values. This helps catch errors at compile time.
questions: How do you declare a variable with a type in TypeScript?
What types can be used in TypeScript?

title: Interfaces
content: Interfaces define the structure of objects and ensure that objects conform to a particular shape, making code more predictable.
questions: How do you define an interface in TypeScript?
Can an interface extend another interface?

title: Classes
content: TypeScript classes are similar to ES6 classes but support access modifiers (public, private, protected) and other OOP features.
questions: How do you declare a class in TypeScript?
What are the access modifiers in TypeScript classes?

title: Generics
content: Generics allow you to write reusable components that work with different types without losing type safety.
questions: What is a generic in TypeScript?
How do you define a generic function or class?
